pullRequest.body:
Also used the new simp lemmas to golf `AlgebraicGeometry/ProjectiveSpectrum/*`

---

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9283582910/job/25544088018)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9283582910/job/25544088267)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9283582910/job/25544088914)
Okay so I found out that the approach in the previous PR wasn't that good as well and this is way better.
Since we are doing refactoring any way, should this be named `neg_mem’` instead, similarly for `mulMem’`
Do we understand why suddenly we need a `by exact`
not tested, maybe just `.mk` would work?
Since we are doing refactoring, should this lemma be called `neg_mem’`

Note that, the `Localization` version is called [Localization.add_mk](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Localization/Basic.html#Localization.add_mk). So there is some inconsistencies here (and in `Localization` namespace)
I think it should be called `Localization.mk_add_mk` instead (and `Localization.mk_mul` to `Localization.mk_mul_mk`)
The PR looks very good to me! I am just not sure about the need to rename `smul_val` as `val_smul`, etc?

The term is actually `HomogeneousLocalization.val (n • y)` and it should be `val_smul` according to the naming convention. This also matches other API lemmas of the same form such as `SetLike.val_smul`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(RingTheory/GradedAlgebra/HomogeneousLocalization) New simp lemmas
